channel.title: Connecting to the Microusb from outside an enclosure
channel.description: So Im mostly done with my enclosure, but I still have to open it up every time I need to connect it to the computer for tweeking the program. Is thee any way to get the microUSB connection to the outside of an enclosure?

item.title: Connecting to the Microusb from outside an enclosure
item.dc:creator: @maximee
item.description:
@maximee wrote:

I would use a panel mount usb jack, preferably the B type, as it is much more solid than the whimsy micro-C.

There are many different types, I’m sure you’ll find a suitable one.

6CC60146-72B9-481A-AA33-3076E846EB94.png640x1136 342 KB

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to the Microusb from outside an enclosure

item.title: Connecting to the Microusb from outside an enclosure
item.dc:creator: @Gavin Gavin
item.description:
@Gavin wrote:

Why don't you leave it permanently connected, this way with the other end, you can connect it to your pc when you need to program it (it will also power it), or in standalone, you connect it to your power source to power it.

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to the Microusb from outside an enclosure

item.title: Connecting to the Microusb from outside an enclosure
item.dc:creator: @Ott
item.description:
@Ott wrote:

You could either cut holes in the side of the enclosure for all the ports, or just get a usb extension cable.

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to the Microusb from outside an enclosure
